answers.answer: Did you get your thyroid antibodies checked when you had thyroid bloodwork done? You might have Graves disease, which can cause nodules on the thyroid, in addition to making it very difficult to gain weight (it's like your metabolism is super-fast when it shouldn't be). Did you have an adrenal panel done, as well, to check for adrenal insufficiency? Diabetes should also be included in the differential--did you have your blood sugar levels checked recently?If you're a hypochondriac and you have the tendency to worry a lot, you might have a fast metabolism to begin with...meaning you're burning off most of what you intake, which probably isn't helping your situation.Keep me posted; I'm interested in hearing if the doctors are able to find anything.

question: I was just wondering if there was anyone out there that has had similiar symptoms.  I have been having shortness of breath, GERD, excessive burping to releave shortness of breath, hard time gaining weight, and now muscle tenderness (feeling of it being bruised) and pulling/strained feeling of that right side neck muscle.  I have had the following testing done:  thyroid blood test (normal), pulmonary test (normal), heart ultrasound (normal), chest xray (normal), Barium swallow (found GERD), Thyroid US (small nodules-not worrisome per dr.), and neck CT (normal).  I just don't know if this is a true neurological disorder or if this is something that I am getting freaked out about (hypochondriac).  I am 29 and weigh 80lbs.  I just want to find out why it is so hard for me to gain weight.I would appreciate any input.Thank you
